title: Property Mapping:
contents:
Property Mapping:link

Multiselect options list requires data in predefined format, format looks like below.

{ "id": 3, "name": "Test 3", "disabled": true }

If the data is not present in the exact format, you can use propertyMap which will be used to transform your current dataset to the expected object structure. For example, the data is

{ "empId": 3, "empName": "Test 3", "empActive": true }

The propertyMap should look like below

propertyMap = { "empId" : "id", "empName" : "name", "empActive" : "disabled" }

So, the multiselect API internally take cares of converting the collection to desire format based on propertyMap mapping.

{ "id": 3, "name": "Test 3", "disabled": true }

Demolink

<ngx-multiselect [propertyMap]="propertyMap" [multiple]="true" [options]="options" multiple="true" ngDefaultControl > </ngx-multiselect> import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'ms-property-map', templateUrl: './property-map.component.html' }) export class PropertyMapComponent implements OnInit { options; propertyMap = { teamId : "id", teamName : "name" } constructor() {} ngOnInit(): void { this.options = [{ "teamId": 1, "teamName": "Manchester United" }, { "teamId": 2, "teamName": "Liverpool F.C." }, { "teamId": 3, "teamName": "Chelsea F.C." }, { "teamId": 4, "teamName": "Arsenal F.C." }, { "teamId": 5, "teamName": "FC Barcelona" }]; } }
